.lrml:Agent.description: an entity that acts or has the capability to act.

.lrml:Agents.description: a collection where every member is an Agent.

.lrml:Alternatives.description:
a mutually exclusive collection where every member is a LegalRuleML
                rendering of one or more Legal Norms.

.lrml:Association.description:
a partial description of the extension of some relations where each
                non-target entity is paired with every target entity.

.lrml:Associations.description: a collection where every member is an Association.

.lrml:Authorities.description: a collection where every member is an Authority.

.lrml:Authority.description:
a person or organization with the power to create, endorse, or enforce
                Legal Norms.

.lrml:AuxiliaryParty.description:
a role in a Deontic Specification to which the Deontic Specification
                is related, but not primarily directed.

.lrml:Bearer.description:
a role in a Deontic Specification to which the Deontic Specification
                is primarily directed.

.lrml:Comment.description: a comment, which has with no semantic effect.

.lrml:Compliance.description:
an indication that an Obligation has been fulfilled or a Prohibition
                has not been violated.

.lrml:ConstitutiveStatement.description:
a Legal Statement which defines concepts and does not prescribe
                behaviours.

.lrml:Context.description:
an application of Associations to their target entities within a
                Scope.

.lrml:DefeasibleStrength.description:
an indication that, in the absence of information to the contrary,
                where the premises of a Legal Rule hold, the conclusion of the Legal Rule
                holds.

.lrml:Defeater.description:
an indication that, in the absence of information to the contrary,
                where the premises of a Legal Rule hold, the opposite of the conclusion of the Legal
                Rule does not hold.

.lrml:Figure.description: an instantiation of a function by an Actor.

.lrml:Figures.description: a collection where every member is a Figure.

.lrml:Jurisdiction.description:
a geographic area or subject-matter over which an Authority applies
                its legal power.

.lrml:Jurisdictions.description: a collection where every member is a Jurisdication.

.lrml:LegalReference.description:
a pair consisting of an internal ID and an enriched non-IRI
                identifier, where the non-IRI is paired with some additional information that is
                sufficient to disambiguate the non-IRI to a unique LegalSource.

.lrml:LegalReferences.description:
a collection where every member is a
                LegalReference.

.lrml:LegalRuleML.description:
a formal representation of one or more LegalSources using the
                LegalRuleML Specifications.

.lrml:LegalSource.description:
a source of one or more Legal Norms formulated in any format and
                endorsed by an Authority.

.lrml:LegalSources.description: a collection where every member is a LegalSource.

.lrml:Obligation.description:
a Deontic Specification for a state, an act, or a course of action to
                which a Bearer is legally bound, and if it is not achieved or performed results in a
                Violation.

.lrml:Override.description:
an indication that a Legal Rule takes precedence over another Legal
                Rule. The ordered pair of Legal Rules is an instance in a defeasible priority
                relation.

.lrml:OverrideStatement.description: a Legal Statement of an Override.

.lrml:Paraphrase.description:
a natural language rendering of a Legal  Rule or fragment of it that
                is an alternative to its Legal Source(s).

.lrml:PenaltyStatement.description:
a Legal Statement of a sanction (e.g. a punishment or a
                correction).

.lrml:Permission.description:
a Deontic Specification for a state, an act, or a course of action
                where the Bearer has no Obligation or Prohibition to the contrary. A weak Permission
                is the absence of the Obligation or Prohibition to the contrary; a strong Permission
                is an exception or derogation of the Obligation or Prohibition to the
                contrary.

.lrml:Prefix.description:
a non-empty prefix declaration in a LegalRuleML
                document.

.lrml:PrescriptiveStatement.description:
a Legal Statement which prescribes behaviours, e.g. with Permissions,
                Obligations, or Prohibitions on states, actions, or courses of
                actions.

.lrml:Prohibition.description:
a Deontic Specification for a state, an act, or a course of action to
                which a Bearer is legally bound, and if it is achieved or performed results in a
                Violation.

.lrml:Reference.description:
a pair consisting of an internal ID and an enriched non-IRI
                identifier, where the non-IRI is paired with some additional information that is
                sufficient to disambiguate the non-IRI to a unique Source.

.lrml:References.description: a collection where every member is a Reference.

.lrml:Reparation.description:
an indication that a PenaltyStatement is linked with a
                PrescriptiveStatement, meaning that a sanction may apply when the
                PrescriptiveStatement entails a Deontic Specification, and there is a Violation of
                the Deontic Specification.

.lrml:ReparationStatement.description: a Legal Statement of a Reparation.

.lrml:Right.description:
(see also Permission) a Deontic Specification that gives a Permission
                to a party (the Bearer) and implies there are Obligations or Prohibitions on other
                parties (the AuxiliaryParty) such that the Bearer can (eventually) exercise the
                Right.

.lrml:Role.description:
a function of or part played by an Actor relative to a LegalRuleML
                expression.

.lrml:Roles.description: a collection where every member is a Role.

.lrml:Source.description: a source of information formulated in any format.

.lrml:Sources.description: a collection where every member is a Source.

.lrml:Statements.description:
a collection where every member is a Legal Statement or a
                FactualStatement.

.lrml:StrictStrength.description:
an indication that where the premises of a Legal Rule are
                indisputable, the conclusion of the Legal Rule is indisputable.

.lrml:SuborderList.description:
a Deontic Specification consisting of a sequence of Deontic
                Specifications other than SuborderLists (at any depth).  When a SuborderList holds,
                a Deontic Specification in the SuborderList holds if all Deontic Specifications that
                precede it in the SuborderList have been violated.

.lrml:TemporalCharacteristic.description:
a pair of Time with a qualification (consisting of a Legal Status and
                a Status Development) that holds at the Time.

.lrml:TemporalCharacteristics.description:
a collection where every member is a Temporal
                Characteristic.

.lrml:Times.description: a collection where every member is a Time.

.lrml:Violation.description:
an indication that an Obligation or Prohibition has been
                violated.

.lrml:appliesAlternatives.description:
a collection of Alternatives applied by the
                Context.

.lrml:appliesAssociation.description: an Association applied by the Context.

.lrml:appliesAssociations.description:
a collection of Associations applied by the
                Context.

.lrml:appliesAuthority.description: an Authority applied by the Context or Association.

.lrml:appliesJurisdiction.description:
a Jurisdiction applied by the Context or
                Association.

.lrml:appliesModality.description:
the deontic mode that applies to a Deontic Specification in a Context
                or Association.

.lrml:appliesPenalty.description:
the PenaltyStatement that is linked to a LegalRule in a
                Reparation.

.lrml:appliesSource.description:
a LegalSource or Reference applied by the Context or
                Association.

.lrml:appliesStrength.description:
a (defeasible) Strength applied by the Context or
                Association.

.lrml:appliesTemporalCharacteristic.description:
a TemporalCharacteristic applied by the Context or
                Association.

.lrml:appliesTemporalCharacteristics.description:
a collection of TemporalCharacteristics applied by the Context or
                Association.

.lrml:atTime.description:
the Time of the qualification of a
                TemporalCharacteristic.

.lrml:filledBy.description: an Actor that fills the Role.

.lrml:forExpression.description:
a LegalRuleML expression for which the Role is responsible e.g., the
                expression was created or endorsed by the role.

.lrml:forStatus.description:
the Legal Status of the qualification in a
                TemporalCharacteristic.

.lrml:fromLegalSources.description:
the LegalSources from which the Alternatives are
                derived.

.lrml:hasActor.description:
an Actor that has the responsibility to fulfill the function of a
                Figure.

.lrml:hasAlternative.description: a member of a collection of Alternatives.

.lrml:hasComment.description: a comment on the parent Node Element.

.lrml:hasContext.description: a Context described in the LegalRuleML document.

.lrml:hasMemberType.description: the type or class of members of the collection.

.lrml:hasParaphrase.description:
a Paraphrase of the parent Node Element (e.g. a Legal
                Rule).

.lrml:hasPrefix.description: a Prefix declared in the LegalRuleML document.

.lrml:hasQualification.description:
a qualification (e.g. an Override) of the
                Statements.

.lrml:hasStatement.description: a Legal Statement in the collection.

.lrml:hasStatusDevelopment.description:
the Status Development of the qualification in a
                TemporalCharacteristic.

.lrml:hasStrength.description: the (defeasible) Strength of the Legal Rule.

.lrml:hasType.description: the type or class of the parent Node Element.

.lrml:inScope.description:
the Statement or (collection of) Statements that the Context is
                applied to.

.lrml:toPrescriptiveStatement.description:
the PrescriptiveStatement that is linked to a PenaltyStatement in a
                Reparation.

.lrml:toTarget.description:
the target to which properties are applied by the
                Association.

.ruleml:Any.description:
<Any>: an interval constructor "any t1, .., tn". See
                http://consumer.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Any

.ruleml:Atom.description:
<Atom>: a predicate applied to arguments. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Atom

.ruleml:Equal.description:
<Equal>: an equation between two terms. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Equal

.ruleml:Fun.description:
<Fun>: a type of name for functional operators. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Fun

.ruleml:Negation.description:
<Negation>: a generic polymorphic negation, which is interpreted by the
                intended semantics (i.e. semantic profile). See
                http://consumer.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Negation

.ruleml:Operation.description:
<Operation>: a generic polymorphic Operation, which is interpreted by
                the intended semantics (i.e. semantic profile). See
                http://consumer.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Operation

.ruleml:Rel.description:
<Rel>: a category of name used as the predicate of an atomic formula.
                See  http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Rel

.ruleml:Skolem.description:
A Skolem individual constant, like RDF's blank nodes. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Skolem

.ruleml:Timer.description:
<Timer>: an interval constructor "After t Every d". See
                http://consumer.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Timer

.ruleml:Var.description:
A logical variable, as in logic programming. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Var

.ruleml:declare.description:
A role used for variables (<Var>) declared within a quantifier (<Forall>
                or <Exists>). See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-declare

.ruleml:degree.description:
An optional uncertainty value (between 0.0 and 1.0) that may be
                assigned to simple formulas. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-degree

.ruleml:left.description:
<left>: The left-hand side of an equation. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-left

.ruleml:oid.description:
<oid>: a label for Node elements. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-oid

.ruleml:repo.description:
A positional rest variable used in <Atom>s, <Expr>s and <Plex>s.  Note that
                <Plex>s are generated, so <repo>s are only available above the Datalog sublanguage.
                See http://www.ruleml.org/0.9/glossary/#gloss-repo

.ruleml:resl.description:
A slotted rest variable used in <Atom>s, <Expr>s and <Plex>s.  Note that
                <Plex>s are generated, so <resl>s are only available above the Datalog sublanguage. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-resl

.ruleml:right.description:
<right>: The right-hand side of an equation. See
                http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-right

ruleml:And.description:
<And>: polyadic conjunction where <And/> is true. See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-And

ruleml:Equivalent.description:
<Equivalent>: Syntactic sugar for two implications. See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Equivalent

ruleml:Exists.description:
Explicit existential quantifier. It consists of one or more
                        variables (<Var>), each optionally surrounded by a <declare> role, followed by a
                        logical formula  (optionally surrounded by a <formula> role). See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Exists

ruleml:Forall.description:
Explicit universal quantifier. It consists of a sequence of
                        one or more  variables (<Var>), each optionally surrounded by a <declare> role,
                        and a logical formula (optionally surrounded by a <formula> role). See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Forall

ruleml:Implies.description:
<Implies>: an implication between two formulas, a premise and a
                        conclusion. See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Implies

ruleml:Neg.description:
A classical negation of a logical atom (<Atom>) (i.e. classical
                        or "strong" negation).  The negated atom may be optionally surrounded by a
                        <strong> role.        See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Neg

ruleml:Or.description:
<Or>: polyadic disjunction where <Or/> is false. See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Or

ruleml:And.description:
<And>: polyadic conjunction where <And/> is true. See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-And

                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Equivalent

lrml:keyref.lrml.datatype.description:
refinement of xsd:anyURI that is a same-document relative IRI
                reference with fragment identifier that belongs to the xsd:NCName lexical
                space

ruleml:Plex.description:
A collection of (ordered) arguments (optionally enclosed by
                        <arg>) and/or (unordered) user-defined slots (<slot>),  identical to an
                        uninterpreted expression (<Expr in="no">) except not having a user-specified
                        function name (equivalent  to having a system-specified constructor 'Plex').
                        Rest variables (<repo> and <resl>) are also permitted.        See
                        http://deliberation.ruleml.org/1.02/glossary/#gloss-Plex within
                        Atom

                        Atom

ruleml:torso.content.description:
An equivalance is syntactic sugar for two implications. In all RuleML
                languages, formulas allowed as premises are the same or more general than those
                allowed as conclusions, because this is a requirement for the statement "P implies
                P" to be syntactically valid whenever P is a valid conclusion. Therefore, formulas
                allowed in equivalences are the same as those allowed in
                conclusions.
